I/O: File Input and Output 

The classes and interfaces for I/O are available on java.io package. 

Ref: javatpoint for I/O


File class: 

The File class provides methods to work on a file such as creating, removing files etc.

import java.io.File;
import java.io.IOException;

public class FileDemo {
	
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		
		File file= new File("tempfile.txt");
		 try {
			boolean result = file.createNewFile();
			System.out.println(result);
		} catch (IOException e) {
			// TODO Auto-generated catch block
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
		
		
	}

}


listing files:

import java.io.File;
import java.io.IOException;

public class FileDemo {
	
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		
		File file = new File("C:\\Users\\SaiKumarPabboju\\Desktop\\javaworkspace\\JavaIO");
		
		 String files[]=file.list();
		 
		 for(int i=0;i<files.length;i++) {
			 System.out.println(files[i]);
		 }
		
		
	}

}

FileOutputStream: 

Used to write data into a file in the form of streams.

import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;

public class FileOutputStreamDemo {
	
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		try {
			FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream("abc.txt");
			String str= "Hello how are you doing";
			fos.write(str.getBytes());
			 fos.flush();
			 fos.close();
		} catch (Exception e) {
			// TODO Auto-generated catch block
			e.printStackTrace();
		} 
	}
	
}


FileInputStream: 

Used to read data from a file. 

import java.io.FileInputStream;


public class FileInputStreamDemo {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		
		try {
			FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream("C:\\Users\\SaiKumarPabboju\\Desktop\\javaworkspace\\JavaIO\\abc.txt");
			//int i=fis.read();
//			int i= 0;
////			  System.out.println((char)i);
////			  System.out.println((char)fis.read());
//			 while ((i= fis.read())!= -1) {
//				 System.out.print((char)i);
//			 }
			 
			byte b[] = fis.readAllBytes();
			
			
			  for(int i=0;i<b.length;i++) {
				  System.out.print((char)b[i]);
			  }
		} catch (Exception e) {
			// TODO Auto-generated catch block
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
		
	}
	
}
